meanings.definition: A projecting beam or structure supported at one end only.
meanings.sent1: The cantilever of the bridge extended out over the river.
meanings.sent2: The architect designed the building with a cantilever to create a unique look.
meanings.sent3: The cantilever of the shelf made it look like it was floating in the air.
meanings.sent4: The tree branch acted like a natural cantilever, reaching out towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cantilever of the diving board made it thrilling to jump off into the pool.

meanings.sent1: The construction workers had to cantilever the platform to ensure stability.
meanings.sent2: They decided to cantilever the roof to provide shade for the patio.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to cantilever the table in his act, but it collapsed.
meanings.sent4: She had to cantilever the bookshelf against the wall to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent5: The engineers had to cantilever the walkway to connect the two buildings.
